Shabad OS B.translation: Vaar 22
One Oankar,the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor
The formless Lord who is without any anchor and is imperceptible, has not made himself fully known to anyone.
From unembodiment He assumed the form by himself and becoming Oankar
He created infinite wondrous forms.
In the form of the true name (ndm) and becoming the creator, He came to be known as the protector of His own reputation.
Through three dimensional maya He nourishes one and all.
He is the creator of the cosmos and prescribes its destiny.

lines.gurmukhi: sBsY dy AwDwru n qoil qulwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sabhasai Day Aadhaaru N Toli Tulaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is the basis of all, the incomparable One.

lines.gurmukhi: iliKAw iQiq n vwru n mwhu jxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Lakhiaa Diti N Vaaru N Maahu Janaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: None has ever disclosed the date, the day and month (of creation).

lines.gurmukhi: vyd kqyb vIcwr n AwiK suxwieAw ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Vayd Katayb Veechaaru N Aakhi Sounaaiaa ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: Even the Vedas and other scriptures could not fully explain His thoughts.
Divine Power
Who without any props, and uncontrolled by habit has created behavioural patterns?
How the swan reaches the heights of sky?
Wondrous is the mystery of wings which made the swan to soar at such heights.

lines.gurmukhi: DRU ciVAw Asmwix n tl tlwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhr Charhiaa Asamaani N Talai Talaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: How did Dhruv in the form of immovable star mount the sky?
It is a mystery how a humble eschewing ego acquires honour in life.
Only the gurmukh who has meditated upon Lord is accepted in His court.
Divine Power

lines.gurmukhi: EVku EVku Bwil n EVku pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aorhaku Aorhaku Bhaali N Aorhaku Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In order to know Him, people put in extreme efforts but could not know His extant.

lines.gurmukhi: EVk Bwlix gey is Pyr n AwieAw ]
lines.transliteration_english: Aorhaku Bhaalani Gaay Si Dhayr N Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who went out to know His bounds could never return.
To know Him, myriads of people have remained wandering in illusions.

lines.gurmukhi: Awdu vfw ivsmwdu n AMqu suxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Aadu Vadaa Visamaadu N Antu Sounaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: That primeval Lord is the grand wonder whose mystery cannot be understood by mere listening.
His waves, shades etc are limitless.

lines.gurmukhi: ieku kvwau pswau n AlKu lKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Iku Kavaau Pasaau N Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The imperceptible Lord who has created all through His single vibration cannot be perceived.
I am sacrifice unto that creator, whose maya is this creation.
The Guru has made me understand that God alone knows about His own self (none else can know Him).
The Creation
The true Creator as the Truth is pervading one and all.

lines.gurmukhi: schu paux aupwie Git Git CwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sachahu Paounu Oupaai Ghati Ghati Chhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Out of Truth He created air and (in the form of vital air) is residing in all
From air was created water which always remains humble i.e. it. always moves down wards.
Earth as a raft is made to float on water.
From water emerged fire which spread throughout the whole vegetation.
By virtue of this very fire (heat) the trees became. full of fruits
In this way, air, water and fire were integrated under the order of that primaeval Lord
And thus was this game of creation arranged.
Creation
Flow great is the'truth that it is liked by that true One (God).
How vast is the air that moves in all the four directions.
Fragrance is placed in sandal which makes other trees also fragrant.

lines.gurmukhi: Kih Kih vMsu gvwie vwNsu jlwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Khahi Khahi Vansu Gavaai Vaansu Jalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Bamboos burn by their own friction and destroy their own abode.
The forms of the bodies have become visible y the association of Siva and Sakti.
One distinguishes between the cuckoo and the crow by listening to their voice.
He created the four life-mines and endowed them worthy speech and judiciously gifted breaths.
He made the A's accept the five gross varieties of the (subtle) unstuck Word and thus on the beat of drum He pronounced His supremacy over all.
Qualities of a sadhu
Music, melody, dialogue and knowledge make man a conscious being.
By disciplining the nine gates of the body one is called a sadhu.

lines.gurmukhi: vIh iekIh aulMiG inj Gir AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Veeh Ikeeh Ulaghi Nij Ghari Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Transcending the worldy illusions he stabilizes within his self.
Prior to this, he was running after various practices of hath yoga,
Such as the rechak, purak, kumbhak, tratak, nyolrand bhujarig asan.
He practised different processes of breathing like ire', pirigala and susumna.
He perfected their khechari and chachari postures.
Through such mysterious sport he establishes himself in the equipoise.
Yoga

lines.gurmukhi: qRYsqu AMgul lY mnu pvxu imlwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Trai Satu Angul Lai Manu Pavanu Milaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The breath going ten fingers out the mind is associated with the vital air the practice is completed.
The imperceptible soham (I am He) is ualised in equipoise.
In this state of equipoise, the rare drink of ever-wing cascade is quaffed.

lines.gurmukhi: Anhd Duin ilv lwie nwd vjwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Anahad Dhouni Liv Laai Naad Vajaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting absorbed in the unstruck melody a mysterious sound is heard.
Through silent prayer, one merges in the Suny (Lord)
And in that perfect mental tranquillity egoism is done away with.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK iprm cKwie inj Gru CwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Piramu Chakhaai Nij Gharu Chhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs drink from the cup of love and establish themselves in their own real self.
Meeting the Guru, the Sikh achieves the perfect completeness.
The Guru and the Sikh
As the lamp is lit from the flame of another lamp;
As sandal's fragrance makes the whole vegetation fragrant
As the water mixing with water acquires the status of trivevi(the confluence of three rivers - Gatiga; Yamuna and Sarasvati);
As air after meeting the vital air becomes unstruck melody;
As a diamond being perforated by another diamond gets stringed into a necklace;
A stone by becoming the philosopher's stone performs its feat and

lines.gurmukhi: Anl pMK puqu hoie ipqw smHwilAw
lines.transliteration_english: Anal Pankhi Poutu Hoi Pitaa Samhaaliaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: As an anil bird getting birth in the sky promotes the work of its father;
Likewise the Guru making the Sikh meet the Lord establishes him in the equipoise.
Praises of the Lord
How great is His one vibration which has created the whole expanse of the world!
How big is His weighing hook that it has sustained the whole creation!
Creating crores of universes He has spread around His power of speech.

lines.gurmukhi: lK lK Driq Agwis ADr DrwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Lakh Dharati Agaasi Adhar Dharaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lakhs of earths and skies He kept hanging without support.
Million types of airs, waters and fires He created.
He created the game of eighty four lakhs of species.

lines.gurmukhi: join join jIA jMq AMq n pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Joni Joni Jeea Jant Antu N Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: No end is known of the creatures of even one species.

lines.gurmukhi: isir isir lyKu ilKwie AlyKu iDAwieAw ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Siri Siri Laykhu Likhaai Alaykhu Dhiaaiaa ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: He has engraved writ on the forehead of all so that they all meditate upon the Lord who is beyond writ.
The way of Gurmukhs
The true Guru has recited (to the disciples) the true name.

lines.gurmukhi: gur mUriq scu Qwau iDAwnu DrwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Moorati Sachu Daau Dhiaanu Dharaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmurati,the word of the Guru is the real object to meditate upon.
The holy congregation is such a refuge where the truth adorns the place.
In the court of the true justice, the order of the Lord prevails.
The village (abode) of the Gurmukhs is the truth which has been habitated with the Word (Sabad).
The ego is decimated there and the (pleasure giving) shade of humility is obtained there.
Through the wisdom of Guru (Gurmati) the unbearable truth is instilled into the heart.

lines.gurmukhi: iqsu bilhwrY jwau su Bwxw BwieAw ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Tisu Balihaarai Jaau Su Bhaanaa Bhaaiaa ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto him who loves the Will of the Lord.
Gurmukh, the supereme stage
Gurmukhs accept the will of that Lord as truth and they love His will.
Bowing at the feet of the true Guru, they shed their sense of ego.
As disciples, they please the Guru and the heart of the Gum becomes happy.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK shij suBwie n AlK lKwvxw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Sahaji Soubhaai N Alakh Lakhaavanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukh realises the imperceptible Lord spontaneously.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK iql n qmwie kwr kmwvxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikh Til N Tamaai Kaar Kamaavanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikh of Guru has no greed at all and he earns his livelihood by the labour of his hands.

lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Liv Laai Houkamu Manaavanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Merging his consciousness into the word he obeys the commands of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: vIh iekIh lMGwie inj Gir jwvxw
lines.transliteration_english: Veeh Ikeeh Laghaai Nij Ghari Jaavanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Crossing beyond the worldly illusions he abides in his own real self.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl pwie shij smwvxw ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Paai Sahaji Samaavanaa ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: This way, the gurmukhs having attained the pleasure fruit absorb themselves in equipoise.
Guru Angad Dev

lines.gurmukhi: ieku gurU ieku isKu gurmuiK jwixAw
lines.transliteration_english: Iku Guroo Iku Sikhu Guramoukhi Jaaniaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs knew very well about the one Guru (Nanak) and one disciple (Guru Angad).

lines.gurmukhi: gur cylw gur isKu sic smwixAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Chaylaa Gur Sikhu Sachi Samaaniaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: By becoming the true Sikh of the Guru, this disciple virtually merged himself into the latter.

lines.gurmukhi: so siqgur so isKu sbdu vKwixAw
lines.transliteration_english: So Satigur So Sikhu Sabadu Vakhaaniaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru and the disciple were identical (in spirit) and their Word was also one.
This is the wonder of the past and the future that they (both) loved the truth.
They were beyond all accounts and were honour of the humble ones.

lines.gurmukhi: smsir AMmiRq ivKu n Awvx jwixAw
lines.transliteration_english: Samasari Anmritu Vikhu N Aavan Jaaniaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: For them, the nectar and poison were the same and they had got liberated from the cycle of transmigration
Recorded as the model of special virtues, they are known as the extremely honourable ones.

lines.gurmukhi: gur isKhu gur isKu hoie hYrwixAw ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhahu Gur Sikhu Hoi Hairaaniaa ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: The wonderful fact is that the sikh of the Guru became the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 gurmuKwN dy l`Cn qy DUV dw pRqwp

Shabad OS B.translation: Virtues of the gurmukhs and the glory of the dust
Gurmukhs drink the unbearable Cup of love filled to the brims and being in the presence of the all;
Pervading Lord they perceive the imperceptible.
The one who resides in all hearts is dwelling in their hearts.
The love creeper of their's has become full of fruits as the seedling of grape turns out to be fruitful vine.
Becoming sandal, they provide coolness to one and all.

lines.gurmukhi: cMdn cMd kpUr n myil imlwvxw

Shabad OS B.translation: Their cool is like the coolness of sandal, moon, and camphor.
Associating the sun (rajas) with the moon (sattv) they assuage its heat.

lines.gurmukhi: crx kvl dI DUir msqik lwvxw
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Dee Dhoori Masataki Laavanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: They put on their forehead the dust of the lotus feet
And come to know the creator as the root cause of all the causes.
When flame (of knowledge) flashes in their heart, the unstruck melody starts ringing.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 gurmuKwN dy l`Cx qy DUV dw pRqwp

Shabad OS B.translation: Virtues of the gurmukhs and the glory of the dust
The power of the one vibration of the Lord transcends all limits.
The wonder and power of Oankft is indescribable.
It is with His support that millions of rivers carrying life water go on flowing.
In His creation, the gurmukhs are known as invaluable diamonds and rubies
And they remain steadfast in gurmati and are accepted with honour in the court of the Lord.
The path of the gurmukhs is straight and clear and they reflect the truth.
Myriad poets desire to know the mystery of His Word.

lines.gurmukhi: crx kvl rj Goil AMmiRq vwxIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Raj Gholi Anmrit Vaaneeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs have quaffed the dust of the feet of Gum like amrit.
This tale is also ineffable.
Waheguru, the wondrous Lord is ineffable

lines.gurmukhi: kwdr no kurbwxu kIm n jwxIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaadaru No Kurabaanu Keem N Jaaneeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto that creator whose value cannot be estimated.
How could anybody tell how old is He?
What could I tell about the powers of theLord who enhances the honour of the humble ones.

lines.gurmukhi: lK ijmI Asmwx iqlu n qulwxIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Jimee Asamaanu Tilu N Tulaaneeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Myriads of earths and skies are not equal to an iota of His.
Millions of universes are wonderstruck to see His power.
He is king of the kings and His ordinance is obvious.
Millions of oceans subsume in His one drop.
Explanations and elaborations pertaining to Him are incomplete (and fake) because His story is ineffable.
Conduct of the gurmukhs
Gurmukhs know well how to move according to the command, hukam of the Lord.
Gurmukh has ordained that community (panth), who moves in the will of Lord.
Becoming contented and true to faith they gratefully thank the Lord.
Gurmukhs perceive His wondrous sport.
They behave innocently like children and eulogize the primaeval Lord.
They merge their consciousness in the holy congregation and truth do they love.
Identifying the word they get liberated and
Loosing their sense of ego they perceive their inner selves.
Glory of the true Guru
The dynamism of the Guru is unmanifest and unfathomable.

lines.gurmukhi: gihr gMBIr AQwh hwiQ n AwxIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Gahari Ganbheer Adaah Haadi N Aaneeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is so deep and sublime that its extent cannot be known.
As from each drop become many tumultuous rivulets,
Likewise the ever-growing glory of gurmukhs becomes ineffable.
His shores near and far cannot be known and He is adorned in infinite ways.
The comings and goings cease after entering the court of the Lord i.e. one becomes liberated from the bondage of  transmigration.
The true Guru is totally carefree yet He is the power of the powerless ones.
Blessed is the true Guru, seeing whom all feel wonderstruck
Holy congregation is the abode of truth
Holy congregation is the abode of truth where gurmukhs go to reside.
Gurmukhs adore the grand and powerful true name (of the Lord).
There skillfully they enhance their inner flame (of knowledge).

lines.gurmukhi: soiD ifTw bHmMfu lvY n lweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Sodhi Ditdaa Brahamandu Lavai N Laaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having seen the whole universe I have found that none reaches His grandeur.

lines.gurmukhi: iqsu nwhI jm fMfu srix smweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Tisu Naahee Jam Dandu Sarani Samaaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He who has come to the shelter of the holy congregation has no longer the fear of death.

lines.gurmukhi: Gor pwp kir KMfu nrik n pweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Ghor Paap Kari Khandu Naraki N Paaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even the horrible sins are decimated and one escapes going to the hell.
As the rice comes out of husk, similarly whosoever goes to the holy congregation gets liberated.
There, homogenous truth prevails and falsehood remains far behind.
Conduct of the gursikhs
Bravo to the Sikhs of Gum who have refined their lives.
The right living of the Sikhs of the Guru is that they love the Guru.
Gurumukhs remember the name of the Lord with every breath and every morsel.
Epudiating pride they remain detached amidst maya.
Gurmukhs consider hemselves as the servant of the servants and service only is their true conduct.
Pondering upon the Word, they remain neutral towards hopes.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK shij invwsu mn hT mwirAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Sahaji Nivaasu Man Hatd Maariaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Eschewing stubbornness of mind, gurmukhs reside in equipoise.
Enlightened  of gurmukhs salvages many a fallen one.
Conduct of the gurmukhs
Those gurmukhs are acclaimed who have found the true Guru.
Practising the Word, they have emancipated their whole families.
Gurmukhs have the Will of God and they work according to the truth.
Eschewing ego, they obtain the door of liberation.
The gurmukhs have made the mind understand the principle of altruism.
The base of gurmukhs is truth and they (finally) get absorbd into truth.
Gurmukhs are not scared of public opinion
And this way they visualise that imperceptible Lord.
Nature of the gurmukhs
Touching the philosopher's stone in the form of gurmukh all the eight metals transform into gold i.e. all the people become pure.

lines.gurmukhi: Ast Dwqu iek Dwqu pwrsu prsxw
lines.transliteration_english: Asat Dhaatu Ik Dhaatu Paarasu Parasanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Like the fragrance of sandal they permeate all the trees i.e. they adopt one and all as their own.
They are like Ganges in which all the rivers and rivulets merge and become full of vitality.
Gurmukhs re the swans of Manasamvar who are not perturbed by other cravings.

lines.gurmukhi: mwn srovr hMs n qiRsnw qrsxw
lines.transliteration_english: Maan Sarovar Hans N Trisanaa Tarasanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikhs of the Guru are the paramharisas, the swans of the highest order
So do not mix up with ordinary ones and their sight is not easily available.
Craving reposed in the shelter of Guru, even the so called untouchables become honourable.

lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Sach Khandu Amar N Marasanaa ?21??22?baaee?

Shabad OS B.translation: The company of the holy, forms the regime of Truth everlasing.
One Onkaar,the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: gur aupdys irdY invws inmRqw invws jwsu iDAwn gur muriq kY pUrn bHm hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Oupadays Ridai Nivaas Nimrataa Nivaas Jaasu , Dhiaan Gur Murati Kai Pooran Braham Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikh in whose heart resides the percept of Guru, and by focusing his mind in the holy feet of the Lord through Simran, the omnipresent Lord dwells in him;

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK sbd suriq aunmwn igAwn shj suBwie srbwqm kY sm hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Sabad Surati Ounamaan Giaana , Sahaj Soubhaai Sarabaatam Kai Sam Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He who lodges the holy word of the True Guru, contemplates on spiritual knowledge and in the process realises that One Supreme Lord exists in all, thus treats all as equals;

lines.gurmukhi: haumY iqAwig iqAwgI ibsmwd ko bYrwgI Bey mn Enmn ilv gMimqw AgMm hY
lines.transliteration_english: Haoumai Tiaagi Tiaagee Bisamaad Ko Bairaagee Bhaay , Man Ao?naman Liv Ganmitaa Aganm Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He who sheds his ego and becomes an ascetic by virtue of Simran, yet live a detached worldly life; reaches the inaccessible Lord,

lines.gurmukhi: sUKm AsQUl mUl eyk hI Anyk myk jIvn mukiq nmo nmo nmo nm hY ]22]
lines.transliteration_english: Sookham Asadool Mool Ayk Hee Anayk Mayka , Jeevan Moukati Namo Namo Namo Nam Hai ?22?

Shabad OS B.translation: He who recognises one Lord manifested in all things subtle and absolute; that Guru-conscious person is emancipated even when living a worldly life. (22)
